intro: Baeobotrys rufescens, commonly known as the red-stemmed mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that grows on the branches of various host trees. It belongs to the family Viscaraceae and is characterized by its small, leathery leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy berries that are an important food source for birds and other wildlife. Baeobotrys rufescens is typically found in tropical and subtropical regions, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it a unique and ecologically significant component of its native ecosystems.
